intro: Chlainanthus, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and striking yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. Native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, Chlainanthus thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
